page.title: 18Appleton Common
page.content: Appleton Lower Common is basically woodland area which is privatly owned leading down to the river.There are two nurseries on the Upper Common. The main crop at Hills Nursery is roses.They cultivate 121 varieties of roses.Rows of roses stretch from the road.On one side asparagus,celery, shrubs and fuscias are also grown. Mr Ford owns Swallows Nurseries. He grows strawberries as his main crop. Most of the crops are grown in special blown up greenhouses.People come to pick their own soft fruit.He also grows crysanthemums for the winter markets. Appleton Woods have two quiet,shadey footpaths leading towards the River Thames.There are the remains of an old wier at the edge of the wood and a house overgrown with reeds and plants. At the moment trees are being felled.
